item.title: Consultancy
item.description: Expert Consultancy Services Take advantage of our experience for all your project, programme or portfolio management. How does it work? Consultancy At Repton Projects the title of Consultant really means something and that’s why all of our Consultants have at least 20 years’ experience delivering complex Projects, Programmes and Portfolios within a wide variety of commercial sectors. If you require expert, unbiased advice that you can trust Repton Projects offer a wide range of consultancy services including:

item.title: Key Project Documents page
item.description: Key Project Documents Quickly create, review and approve key project documents. Create Your Document Structured document designs for all key project documents. Get Started » Review Your Document Avoid costly mistakes by reviewing documents. Submit documents for review to selected stakeholders. Review all comments from a single location. Get Started » Approve Your Document Submit documents for final approval to selected stakeholders. Review all approval comments from a single location.

item.title: Management Processes: Changes
item.description: Change Management Manage changes to your project in a controlled and coordinated way. Avoid Scope Creep Use the Change Management tool to ensure you only implement the necessary changes to your project. Get Started » Impact Assessment Justify each change request by performing an impact assessment in terms of time, cost and quality. Get Started » Make Better Decisions Present change requests to the Change Control Board or Sponsor for their approval or rejection.

item.title: Management Processes: Lessons
item.description: Lesson Learned Avoid costly mistakes by building a knowledge base that everyone can access. Stop Wasting Useful Information Enhance future projects by recording your lessons learned. Get Started » Promote Good Practice Collect and share the things that you have done well and not so well in your organisation. Get Started » Don't Make The Same Mistakes Save time and money by reviewing lessons from previous projects. Get Started »

item.title: Management Processes: Quality
item.description: Project Management Processes Develop project management strategies for managing your project's Quality, Costs, Schedule, Risks, Communication, Procurement and Human Resources. Quality Management Plan Build quality management into your projects right from the start. Define your quality management to include Quality Assurance, Scope Management and Change, Testing, Defect Repair strategies.. Get Started » Cost Management Plan Manage your project's budget by ensuring an effective cost management strategy is in place.

item.title: Monitoring & Control: Actions
item.description: Actions Create and allocate tasks to your project team. Tracking Progress Record all key project tasks. Prioritise tasks based on impact on project. Assign tasks to individual project team members. Use review and due dates to monitor progress. Get Started » View On Dashboard Use Pending Actions on the dashboard to execute assigned tasks. Get Started » Search Actions Use Action Management's customisable search feature to easily locate specific tasks.

item.title: Monitoring & Control: Assumptions
item.description: Assumptions Record, maintain, review and validate your project's assumptions. Validate Your Assumptions Record all key assumptions. Assign assumptions to specific owners. Confirm assumptions using review and validation dates. Get Started » Search Assumptions Use Assumption Management's customisable search feature to easily locate specific assumptions. Get Started » Import Assumptions Save time by importing known assumption from similar projects. Get Started »

item.title: Monitoring & Control: Budget
item.description: Project Budgets Create and maintain project cost plans. Control Your Project's Finances Create individual cost plans for your project team, capital expenditure, external consultancy and general expenses. Get Started » Track Total Costs Maintain forecast versus actual costs to track your project's current and outstanding spend. Get Started » Cost Summaries View Finance or Forecast Versus Actual Summaries. Get Started » Management Information Use the Status Reporting tool to automatically produce a finance status report.

item.title: Monitoring & Control: Constraints
item.description: Constraints Manage key project constraints in terms of time, cost and quality. Plan Your Project Within Your Constraints Record and categories key constraints. Assign constraints to a specific owners. Review constraints on specified dates. Get Started » Search Constraints Use Constraint Management's customisable search feature to easily locate specific constraints. Get Started » Import Constraints Save time by importing known constraints from similar projects. Get Started »

item.title: Monitoring & Control: Decisions
item.description: Decisions Maintain an audit trail of key decisions. Avoid Costly Misunderstandings Record key decisions that are made throughout the life of your project. Get Started » Search Decisions Use Decision Management's customisable search feature to easily locate specific decisions. Get Started »

item.title: Monitoring & Control: Issues
item.description: Issue Management Monitor and control your project's issues as they arise. Issue Profile Use the issue profile to highlight key issues. Get Started » Categorise Issues Group your issues into pre-definedd categories. Get Started » Response Planning By assessing the impact of the issue, you can formulate the best response. Get Started » Appoint An Owner Allocate issues to the right project stakeholder to ensure that they are quickly resolved.

item.title: Monitoring & Control: Risks
item.description: Risk Management Monitor and control your project's risks before they become expensive issues. Risk Profile Use the risk profile to highlight key risks. Get Started » Categorise Risks Group your risks into business, technical, operational or financial categories. Get Started » Response Planning By assessing the risk's probability and impact you can accept, mitigate, eliminate or transfer the risk. Get Started » Appoint An Owner Allocate risks to specific owners to ensure they receive the attention that they deserve.

item.title: Monitoring & Control: Schedule
item.description: Dependencies Plan your project according to key dependencies. Understand Key Dependencies Record and categories key dependencies. Assign dependencies to specific owners. Review dependencies on specified dates. Get Started » Search Dependencies Use Dependency Management's customisable search feature to easily locate specific dependencies. Get Started » Import Dependencies Save time by importing known dependencies from similar projects. Get Started »

item.title: Monitoring & Control: Schedule
item.description: Project Schedule Plan your project using the project schedule. Create Your Project Plan Use a work breakdown structure to organise individual tasks using parent and child relationships. Get Started » Drag And Drop Utilise Drag and Drop functionality to easily reorder and structure your tasks. Get Started » Task Dependencies Maintain critical task dependencies within your project plan. Get Started » Add Task Notes Record additional information for each project task.

item.title: Project Stakeholders page
item.description: Project Stakeholders Ensure you have the right people within your team. Ensure You Have The Right Leadership Assign a Project Sponsor to own the project. Set up a Steering Group to provide project oversight. Establish a Change Control Board to minimise risks. Get Started » Ensure You Have The Right Skills Define Project roles. Assign Roles to Project Stakeholders. Highlight missing skills using the Required Skills Matrix. Get Started » Configure Access Rights Grant or Revoke stakeholder permissions to specific tools or documents.

item.title: Projects page
item.description: Project Configuration Only do the things that add real value. Quickly Set Up Your Project Create a new project and assign a start date and you are ready to go. Get Started » Manage Your Team Assign team members as project stakeholders. Get Started » Ensure You Are Only Doing The Things That Add Value Configure the required project tasks and documents. Get Started »

item.title: Reporting: Status Reports
item.description: Status Reports Creating Project Status Reports couldn't be easier, just select what you want to include and the report will be automatically generated for you. Tailor Your Status Reports Customise the included content. Assign RAG (Red, Amber, Green) status to your Project Status Report. Enhance your Status Report by adding additional information as required. Produce summary or detailed level reports to match individual requirements. Get Started » Report On Your Project's Schedule Report progress against your project's Schedule by selecting Completed, In Progress, Late and Milestone tasks.

item.title: Requirements and Design: Requirements
item.description: Project Requirements Ensure your project delivers exactly what your customer requires. Create A Structured Requirements Specification Structure your project's requirements using parent and child relationships Get Started » Drag And Drop Utilise drag and drop functionality to easily reorder and structure your project's requirements. Get Started » Categorise And Prioritise Ensure that you gather both functional and non-functional requirements for your project. Use MoSCoW to prioritise your project's requirements. Get Started » Upload Attachments Enhance individual requirements by uploading related information.

item.title: Requirements and Design: Solution Design
item.description: Design Specification Using Project on Demands's Design Specification and Traceability tools you can ensure that your Design Specification addresses all the project's requirements. Create A Structured Design Specification Structure your Design Specification using parent and child relationships. Get Started » Drag And Drop Utilise drag and drop functionality to easily reorder and structure your design elements. Get Started » Upload Attachments Enhance individual design elements by uploading related information.

item.title: Requirements and Design: Traceability
item.description: Traceability Using the Traceability tool you can ensure that your Design Specification addresses all the project's requirements. Avoid Costly Omissions Use Project on Demand's traceability tool to easily ensure that each design element is aligned to individual requirements. Get Started »

item.title: Training
item.description: Practical Training Courses Project Management training delivered by professional Project Managers. Repton Projects provides a range of Project Management training which has been developed by experienced Project Management Consultants who have had a wealth of experience. This training provides a practical approach to Project Management to individual companies either on premises in Nottingham in the UK, or on site at a location of your choice. Training Courses: 1. Introduction to Project Management Description Content Suitable for This 1 day course has been designed to provide delegates with an introduction to the core principles of Project Management.

item.title: Workflow Dashboard Page
item.description: Monitor and control your project’s workflow Review key Risks, Issues, Assumptions, Dependencies & Constraints. Monitor & Control Use the phase progression feature to track project progress. Get Started » Pending Actions View and Execute your pending actions direct from the dashboard. Get Started » Manage Key Project Elements Risks / Issues - Ensure risks don’t turn into issues. Constraints - Ensure you work within project constraints. Dependencies - Create reliable project plans.

item.title: Workflow Phase Progression page
item.description: Phase Progression Manage your project from start to finish using six configurable project phases. Start Up Phase Maximise the return on your investments by ensuring you undertake the correct projects for your organisation. Get Started » Initiation Phase Ensure your project has a viable Business Case before committing resources to the project. Ensure your project can be delivered on time. Prime your project to succeed by implementing tried and tested management processes.
